meanings.definition: A set of tuned bells or metal bars that produce musical sounds when struck
meanings.sent1: The beautiful chimes echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to the chimes on a windy day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to play a tune on the chimes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out like chimes in the crisp air.
meanings.sent5: The chimes sang a melody that touched my heart.

meanings.definition: A ringing sound produced by a bell or bells
meanings.sent1: The chimes of the church bell signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The chimes of the ice cream truck brought joy to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The chimes of the doorbell startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: His voice carried a chimes-like quality that was soothing to hear.
meanings.sent5: The chimes of the wind chime created a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To make a musical sound by striking bells or metal bars
meanings.sent1: She gently chimes the bells to create a calming effect.
meanings.sent2: The children love to chimes the metal bars in the music class.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally chimes the wind chime with its tail.
meanings.sent4: His laughter seemed to chimes through the room.
meanings.sent5: The wind chime chimes softly in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To produce a ringing sound, like that of a bell
meanings.sent1: The old clock chimes every hour.
meanings.sent2: The distant church bell chimes in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The phone chimes just as she was about to leave.
meanings.sent4: Her voice chimes with excitement when she talks about her travels.
meanings.sent5: The wind chime chimes in harmony with the rustling leaves.
